alert.note: Alert for Garden (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 9:35PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected, mainly in low lying areas. * WHERE...A portion of panhandle Nebraska, including the following county, Garden. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 831 PM MDT, Runoff from earlier heavy rainfall will continue to cause minor flooding for the next hour or so. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lewellen, Intersection of Highway 27 and 9 Mile Road, Ash Hollow State Historical Park and Windlass Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
